the news today is that troops or forces

there was some organ organ ization

and they just took to the streets they
just started riding without any game

which side the interior minister said

the problem is you know in other

see in the military step into play a

here there's no there's no one in the

careful not to make the condom Nations
overly personal the suffering and

haven't invoked the name Muammar Qaddafi
and the reason for that is that they're
concerned about getting their own
diplomatic personnel out of the country
this has been a complicated undertaking
there's been a lack of seats on
commercial flights and they've had
trouble getting the Libyan authorities
to approve charter flights into Tripoli
the capital on Wednesday the United
States chartered a ferry and this may
relieve the pressure and get most of the
American diplomats and their dependents
out of the country but there are other
issues as well the US has not talked
about reimposing sanctions on Libya and
the argument officials make is that
process takes time you have to build a
legal case against the government at the
United Nations in order to get the votes
for a sanctions resolution but the
restrained posture of the administration
has brought some criticism from former
administration officials and others who
say that the United States has actually
been tougher on Hosny Mubarak and ally
of the United States than it has on
moammar qaddafi a longtime adversary
administration officials say that they
do have plans to take tougher action

quite likely that when the last American

Italy Libya is a former Italian colony
and the countries have had long-standing

now Italy relies on Libya for much of
